headline: AMD Wins Big AI Chip Order From Oracle in Race to Catch Nvidia
summary: Oracle will put 50,000 of the semiconductors in data center computers starting in the third quarter of 2026, according to a statement Tuesday.  The systems will contain AMD processors and networking components.  The Santa Clara, California-based company is working to become a credible alternative to Nvidia, the dominant provider of AI processors.

raw.headline: AMD Wins Big AI Chip Order From Oracle in Race to Catch Nvidia
raw.summary: Oracle will put 50,000 of the semiconductors in data center computers starting in the third quarter of 2026, according to a statement Tuesday. The Santa Clara, California-based company is working to become a credible alternative to Nvidia, the dominant provider of AI processors.

headline: TeraWulf to Raise $3.2 Billion for Google-Backed Data Center. The Stock Is Rising.
summary: TeraWulf  the data-center operator best known for its Bitcoin mining facilities, plans to offer $3.2 billion in senior secured notes due in 2030 in a private offering, the company announced Tuesday.  It will use the proceeds to finance a portion of its Lake Mariner data-center campus in upstate New York.  TeraWulf  didn’t immediately respond to requests for further comment.

headline: Rimini Street to Report Third Quarter 2025 Financial Results on October 30, 2025
summary: LAS VEGAS, October 14, 2025--Rimini Street, Inc. (Nasdaq: RMNI), a global provider of end-to-end enterprise software support, managed services and innovation solutions, and the leading third-party support provider for Oracle, SAP and VMware software, today announced it will report earnings after market close on October 30, 2025. The company will host a conference call and webcast on that date to discuss the third quarter and the 2025 outlook at 5:00 p.m. Eastern / 2:00 p.m. Pacific time.

raw.headline: Rimini Street to Report Third Quarter 2025 Financial Results on October 30, 2025
raw.summary: LAS VEGAS, October 14, 2025--Rimini Street, Inc. (Nasdaq: RMNI), a global provider of end-to-end enterprise software support, managed services and innovation solutions, and the leading third-party support provider for Oracle, SAP and VMware software, today announced it will report earnings after market close on October 30, 2025. The company will host a conference call and webcast on that date to discuss the third quarter and the 2025 outlook at 5:00 p.m. Eastern / 2:00 p.m. Pacific time.

headline: Dow Turns Higher After Falling More Than 600 Points
summary: The blue-chip index was up 200 points, or 0.4%, after falling more than 600 points, or 1.3%, at its low.  Only 11 of the Dow's 30 stocks were falling, but Goldman Sachs, alone, was shaving 65 points off the index after reporting quarterly results.

raw.headline: Dow Turns Higher After Falling More Than 600 Points
raw.summary: The blue-chip index was up 200 points, or 0.4%, after falling more than 600 points, or 1.3%, at its low.  Only 11 of the Dow's 30 stocks were falling, but Goldman Sachs, alone, was shaving 65 points off the index after reporting quarterly results.

headline: The Market Selloff That Wasn’t
summary: The three major stock market indexes were all in the red as of late Tuesday morning.  The S&P 500, a market-cap weighted index, was down about 0.5%, dragged lower by losses in megacap techs (and artificial intelligence darlings) such as Nvidia, Oracle, Broadcom and Arista Networks.  Wells Fargo was a top gainer in the index following solid earnings. Ditto for Domino’s Pizza, a recent Barron’s stock pick. Casino stocks MGM Resorts, Las Vegas Sands and Wynn Resorts were rallying too, as were Airbnb and retailers Walmart and Dollar Tree.

Casino stocks MGM Resorts, Las Vegas Sands and Wynn Resorts were rallying too, as were Airbnb and retailers Walmart and Dollar Tree.

headline: Oracle to Deploy 50,000 AI Chips From AMD. The Stock Is Rising.
summary: FEATURE   Oracle and Advanced Micro Devices announced an expanded artificial-intelligence partnership Tuesday that will see Oracle deploy tens of thousands of AMD’s most advanced AI chips next year.  Oracle Cloud Infrastructure the company’s cloud-computing arm, will be a launch partner for the first publicly available AI “supercluster” powered by AMD’s next-generation Instinct MI450 graphics processing units, or GPUs.

raw.headline: Oracle to Deploy 50,000 AI Chips From AMD. The Stock Is Rising.
raw.summary: FEATURE   Oracle and Advanced Micro Devices announced an expanded artificial-intelligence partnership Tuesday that will see Oracle deploy tens of thousands of AMD’s most advanced AI chips next year.  Oracle Cloud Infrastructure the company’s cloud-computing arm, will be a launch partner for the first publicly available AI “supercluster” powered by AMD’s next-generation Instinct MI450 graphics processing units, or GPUs.
